medical_history.chief_complaint: 5 days of nausea and vomiting (N/V) and inability to tolerate oral intake.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms began 5 days prior to admission. She has a history of nausea and vomiting associated with gastroparesis, leading to a 25lb weight loss. She experienced a recurrence of nausea and vomiting coinciding with a new urinary tract infection (UTI). Currently, she is unable to tolerate oral intake, is passing flatus but no stools for several days, and rates abdominal pain as crampy without alleviating or exacerbating factors.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Polycystic kidney disease, hypertension secondary to polycystic kidney disease, gastroparesis, history of recurrent nausea and vomiting, hysterectomy with complications, ventral hernia mesh repair, osteoporosis, osteoarthritis.
medical_history.family_history: Patient is adopted; family history is unknown. Two of her four daughters have been diagnosed with autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease (ADPKD).
